result.execSummary:
The defendant Todd G. AUGUSTINE was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Deliver Cocaine within 1000 feet of school as repeater (<=1g) [Modifiers: Possession with Intent to Deliver/Distribute a Controlled Substance On or Near a School, Second and Subsequent Offense], a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(cm)1g.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Execution of sentence is stayed and the defendant is placed on probation to DOC.

miscConds.notes: If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.
Maintain full-time employment, schooling or a combination of both.

Pay supervision fees in an amount to be determined by the Department of Corrections.

Submit to random urine screens and pay for same.

Maintain absolute sobriety.

Submit a DNA sample and pay surcharge.

Assessment, treatment, counseling as deemed appropriate by the Department's assessment process.

Defendant is to have no association with any known drug users or dealers.

Defendant is to use only one doctor to prescribe medications and one pharmacist to dispense medications.

timeConds.notes: Under the Huber Law, to commence immediately upon completion of the jail sentences imposed on 16 CF 529, 16 CF 108, 16 CF 442 and 16 CF 314.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

Plea date on May 16, 2016 at 03:00 pm.

Settlement Conference Summary.
Plea hearing is set for 06-11-16 at 2:30 p.m.

This case is riding along with 15 cf 657 which is set for a settlement conference with D.A. on 04-15-16 at 10:00 a.m.
Minutes.

This case continues to ride along with 15 CF 657.  Preliminary hearing has been reset to 03-04-16 at 1:30 p.m.
Minutes.

Defendant in custody on WRIT.
The doctors report finds the defendant competent to proceed in this matter.
The Court questions the defendant.  The defendant agrees with the findings in the report and states he is competent.
The Court accepts the doctor's findings as to competency, finds the defendant has freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his right to a competency hearing and finds that the defendant is competent to proceed in this matter
This case is to track a new matter in 15 CF 657.
Minutes.

Writ of Habeas Corpus Ad Prosequendum and Order to Sheriff to transport defendant for a competency hearing on 01-21-16 at 2:30 p.m.

Report of Kasturi Kripakaran. M.D.
Competency hearing at 01-21-2016 02:30 pm
Report of Brooke E. Lundbohm, Psy.D.

Order of Commitment for Treatment (Incompetency).
Review date is set for 01-15-16 at 11:30 a.m.
Fax cover sheets.

The parties have reviewed the report and stipulate that the defendant is not competent to proceed at this time and would be a good candidate for the Outpatient Competency Restoration Program.
The defendant does not contest the doctor's findings.
Based on the report and the stipulation of the parties, the Court finds the defendant not competent to proceed and that he would be treatable on an outpatient basis.
Court will prepare the appropriate order.
